thread.title: Shell icebreaker retreats after showdown with protesters
thread.title_full: Shell icebreaker retreats after showdown with protesters

title: Shell icebreaker retreats after showdown with protesters
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Thu, Jul 30, 2015, 16:53 BST - UK Markets closed Shell icebreaker retreats after showdown with protesters Shell icebreaker retreats after showdown with activists dangling off Portland, Oregon, bridge By Steven Dubois, Associated Press | Associated Press – 51 minutes ago View Photo 
Activists hang off the St. Johns Bridge to protest Shell Oil's drilling in the Arctic, in Portland, … 
PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) -- A Shell Oil icebreaker has retreated after a showdown with environmental activists dangling from Portland, Oregon's tallest bridge. 
Environmental activists on St. Johns Bridge and kayakers on the water below have been blocking the icebreaker from heading to the Arctic for a drill operation. 
The icebreaker Fennica arrived in Portland for repairs last week. The vessel was damaged earlier this month in the Aleutian Islands when it struck an underwater obstruction, tearing a gash in its hull. 
It started its journey to the Arctic early Thursday before stalling in the face of 13 dangling activists linked by ropes. It then turned around to the delight of protesters gathered in a nearby park. 
The U.S. Coast Guard warned the activists they were breaking the law, but took no action.
